thread.title: Set sail with The Walking Dead stars on zombie-themed cruise
thread.title_full: Set sail with The Walking Dead stars on zombie-themed cruise

author: Kylie McLaughlin
title: Set sail with The Walking Dead stars on zombie-themed cruise
text:
Set sail with The Walking Dead stars on zombie-themed cruise KYLIE MCLAUGHLIN Last updated 16:35, July 9 2015 Twitter / @WalkingDeadNot 
Norman Reedus stars as one of the series' main characters, Daryl Dixon, and will be a major drawcard for the cruise. 
Being trapped at sea on a ship with a bunch of would-be zombies sounds like a premise for a horror movie itself, but no, this is an actual thing confirmed to set sail from Miami, January 2016. 
The Norwegian Pearl's newly-announced cruise will be a three-day zombie-themed adventure and will feature some of the cast members of the The Walking Dead . 
A major drawcard for the cruise will be the presence of the show's biggest star, Norman Reedus, who plays the hillbilly with heart, Daryl "if Daryl-dies-we-riot" Dixon. Also on board will be Chandler Riggs (Carl), Sonequa Martin-Green (Sasha) and Christian Serratos (Rosita). 
The Norwegian Pearl, before the zombie apocalypse. 
Characters already laid to rest such as cast favourite Emily Kinney (Beth), who shocked viewers with her bloody exit, will also be on board. Joining her will be former cast members Chad L. Coleman (Tyreese) and Lawrence Gilliard, Jr (Bob). As the date draws closer, more celebrity guests may be announced. 
And if it's anything like Walking Dead-themed horror nights at Universal Studios, you'll need to pack your running shoes as the normal cruise ship is transformed into a zombie apocalypse for three days of horror-filled fun. 
The ship will leave Miami on January 15 and dock at Nassau, Bahamas, on January 18â€¦ pending on survival. 
On board, "superfans", as they have been monikered, will be entertained with Q&As, panels and more with the stars and the Walker Stalkers, the masterminds behind the cruise. 
Participants will also get a chance to have their photo taken with the stars of the show, enjoy the "complete zombie makeup experience", partake in zombie gaming, costume contests, theme nights plus more to be announced. 
Prices start at $US750 (NZ$1113) twin share, including all meals and amenities. For the 2200 fans expected to board the ship, this is expected to be a once in a lifetime opportunity. 
If you're keen on braving the cruise, check out the voyage's official website .
